2000.info: The start game event is triggered at the very beginning of the game (after the game finishes loading, don’t wait for intro movie to finish). This is used to compute things like time spent in game.

args.info: version identifier for the current build of the game
args.name: version

args.info: is create mode unlocked (from a previous playthrough)
args.name: create_mode_unlocked

args.info: list of the unlocked status of each hamster
args.name: unlocked_hamsters

args.info: list of all unlocked rounds
args.name: unlocked_rounds

2020.info: The start round event is triggered at the start of a round when a new scene is presented to the player. This event provides information about the game characteristics of the round (i.e. resources, objectives, setup). It is used in calculating things like time spent in a round (for speed and accuracy), attempts at solving a round, and the number of rounds the player has visited (exposures).

args.info: type of round that has just started. e.g. "normal" or "super snack"
args.name: round_type

2025.info: The start creation mode event is triggered when the player begins a creation mode round. It is used in calculating things like time spent in a round and the number of rounds the player has visited (exposures).

2030.info: The beat round event is triggered when the player finishes a round. This event is used for calculating time spent in a round (for speed and accuracy), attempts at solving a round, and the number of rounds the player has completed (completion).

args.info: the duration of the round in milliseconds. Time between start round and beat round.
args.name: duration

args.info:
"final layout of the round
{ ""placed_blocks"": [{""block_type"": string, ""block_id"": string, ""coordinates"": object, ""rotation"": float }, ... ]"
args.name: final_state

args.info: type of round
args.name: round_type

args.info: indicates if the super snack was collected
args.name: snack_collected

2031.info: The abort round event is triggered when the exits a round via the back button. This event is used for calculating time spent in a round (for speed and accuracy), attempts at solving a round, and the number of rounds the player has completed (completion).

args.info: the duration of the round in milliseconds. Time between start round and beat round.
args.name: duration

args.info:
"final layout of the round
{ ""placed_blocks"": [{""block_type"": string, ""block_id"": string, ""coordinates"": object, ""rotation"": float }, ... ], ""hamster_coordinatess"": [ {""hamster_id"": string, ""coordinates"": object}, …] }"
args.name: final_state

2035.info: The end creation mode event is triggered when the player exits creation mode. This event is used for calculating time spent in a round and the number of rounds the player has completed (completion).

args.info: the duration of the round in milliseconds. Time between start round and beat round.
args.name: duration

args.info:
"final layout of the round
{ ""placed_blocks"": [{""block_type"": string, ""block_id"": string, ""coordinates"": object, ""rotation"": float }, ... ], ""hamster_coordinatess"": [ {""hamster_id"": string, ""coordinates"": object}, …] }"
args.name: final_state

2080.info: The movie started event triggers when an intro or outro movie starts to play. It identifies the movie being played. This is used to determine how long players spend watching the movies (more relevant after the first play through when the skip option is available). The movie_id should be a string composed of the voiceover audio id, and the number and type of each animal with colon separators. Example: “goodjob:2_chicken:1_cow”

args.info: the identifier for the movie that was playing
args.name: movie_id

args.info: the duration of the media playback in milliseconds
args.name: duration

args.info: the text or description of the instruction
args.name: description

2081.info: The movie skipped event triggers when the player presses the skip button during an intro or outro movie. It identifies the movie being played. This is used to determine how long players spend watching the movies (more relevant after the first play through when the skip option is available). The movie_id should be a string composed of the voiceover audio id, and the number and type of each animal with colon separators. Example: “goodjob:2_chicken:1_cow”

args.info: the identifier for the movie that was playing
args.name: movie_id

args.info: the duration of the media playback in milliseconds
args.name: duration

args.info: the time the media has been playing milliseconds when the button is pressed
args.name: time_played

args.info: the text or description of the instruction
args.name: description

2083.info: The movie ended event triggers when an intro or outro movie ends. It identifies the movie being played. This is used to determine how long players spend watching the movies (more relevant after the first play through when the skip option is available). The movie_id should be a string composed of the voiceover audio id, and the number and type of each animal with colon separators. Example: “goodjob:2_chicken:1_cow”

args.info: the identifier for the movie that was playing
args.name: movie_id

args.info: the duration of the media playback in milliseconds
args.name: duration

args.info: the text or description of the instruction
args.name: description

2090.info: The unlock create mode event is triggered when create mode is unlocked after the player has cleared the necessary requirements.

2091.info: The unlock new hamster event is triggered when a new hamster is unlocked after the player has cleared the necessary requirements.

args.info: name of the unlocked hamster
args.name: new_hamster

args.info: list of the unlocked status of each hamster
args.name: unlocked_hamster

2092.info: The unlock new rounds event is triggered when new rounds are unlocked after the player has cleared the necessary requirements.

args.info: list of newly unlocked rounds
args.name: new_rounds

args.info: list of all unlocked rounds
args.name: unlocked_rounds

3010.info: The system-initiated instruction event occurs when the game delivers instructions to the player. It contains information that describes the content of the instruction. This event differs from events 3020 and 3021 as it captures instructions that are not given in response to player action. These events are used to determine the effectiveness of the instructions. We can answer questions like, “did players who received instruction X do better than those who did not?”

args.info:
"the type of media that has just played:
'audio' || 'animation' || 'other"
args.name: media_type

args.info: the estimated duration of the media playback in milliseconds (if it ran uninterrupted)
args.name: total_duration

args.info: the text or description of the instruction
args.name: description

args.info: a unique identifier for this piece of instruction
args.name: identifier

3110.info: The end of system-initiated instruction event occurs when the game finishes delivering instructions to the player. It contains information that describes the content of the instruction including duration. These events are used to determine the effectiveness of the instructions and the amount of time they consume. We can answer questions like, “how much time elapsed while the game was presenting instruction?”

args.info:
"the type of media that has just played:
'audio' || 'animation' || 'other"
args.name: media_type

args.info: the duration of the media playback in milliseconds
args.name: duration

args.info: the text or description of the instruction
args.name: description

args.info: a unique identifier for this piece of instruction
args.name: identifier

4010.info: This event occurs when the player clicks to start the game from the starting screen.

args.info:
"the game screen coordinates of the click
dictionary:
{“x”: integer, “y”: integer, “stage_width”: integer, “stage_height”: integer}"
args.name: coordinates

4011.info: This event occurs when the player clicks to choose the play mode from the initial choices screen.

args.info:
"the game screen coordinates of the click
dictionary:
{“x”: integer, “y”: integer, “stage_width”: integer, “stage_height”: integer}"
args.name: coordinates

4012.info: This event occurs when the player clicks to choose the create mode from the initial choices screen.

args.info:
"the game screen coordinates of the click
dictionary:
{“x”: integer, “y”: integer, “stage_width”: integer, “stage_height”: integer}"
args.name: coordinates

4013.info: This event occurs when the player clicks on one of the thumbnails to select a round.

args.info:
"the game screen coordinates of the click
dictionary:
{“x”: integer, “y”: integer, “stage_width”: integer, “stage_height”: integer}"
args.name: coordinates

args.info: is the round that was clicked unlocked?
args.name: round_unlocked

4014.info: This event occurs when the player clicks on one of the arrows to navigate between the round selection screens.

args.info:
"the game screen coordinates of the click
dictionary:
{“x”: integer, “y”: integer, “stage_width”: integer, “stage_height”: integer}"
args.name: coordinates

args.info: previous screen navigated away from
args.name: last_screen

args.info: the new screen to be displayed
args.name: new_screen

4015.info: This event occurs when the player clicks to select one of the hamsters to use during play mode.

args.info:
"the game screen coordinates of the click
dictionary:
{“x”: integer, “y”: integer, “stage_width”: integer, “stage_height”: integer}"
args.name: coordinates

args.info: the hamster selected
args.name: hamster

4016.info: This event occurs when the player clicks the next button to advance to the next round.

args.info:
"the game screen coordinates of the click
dictionary:
{“x”: integer, “y”: integer, “stage_width”: integer, “stage_height”: integer}"
args.name: coordinates

4017.info: This event occurs when the player clicks the retry button to retry the current round.

args.info:
"the game screen coordinates of the click
dictionary:
{“x”: integer, “y”: integer, “stage_width”: integer, “stage_height”: integer}"
args.name: coordinates

4018.info: This event occurs when the player clicks the button to transition from play mode to creation mode as offered at the end of certain rounds.

args.info:
"the game screen coordinates of the click
dictionary:
{“x”: integer, “y”: integer, “stage_width”: integer, “stage_height”: integer}"
args.name: coordinates

4019.info: This event occurs when the player clicks the back button to exit a round or return to the main menu.

args.info:
"the game screen coordinates of the click
dictionary:
{“x”: integer, “y”: integer, “stage_width”: integer, “stage_height”: integer}"
args.name: coordinates

args.info:
"the previous screen being navigated away from
e. g. ""playing"", ""round selection"", ""creating"", etc."
args.name: last_mode

args.info:
"the new screen being displayed
e. g. ""playing"", ""round selection"", ""creating"", etc."
args.name: new_mode

4020.info: This event occurs when the player places a block in the scene. It contains information about the block placed and where the click occurred.

args.info:
"the game screen coordinates of the click
dictionary:
{“x”: integer, “y”: integer, “stage_width”: integer, “stage_height”: integer}"
args.name: coordinates

args.info:
"object describing the placed block
{""block_type"": string - e.g.  ""horizontal line"", ""square"", ""triangleL"", ""triangleR"", etc., ""coordinates"": object, ""block_id"": string }"
args.name: placed_block

args.info: the duration of the drag in milliseconds
args.name: duration

args.info: indicates if the round is currently paused after having been started
args.name: round_paused

args.info: "click" or "drag" type of drag used to move the object
args.name: drag_type

4021.info: This event occurs when the player places a block in the scene during create mode. It contains information about the object placed, the current state of the round, and where the click occurred.

args.info:
"the game screen coordinates of the click
dictionary:
{“x”: integer, “y”: integer, “stage_width”: integer, “stage_height”: integer}"
args.name: coordinates

args.info:
"object describing the placed block
{""object_type"": string - e.g.  ""horizontal line"", ""square"", ""triangleL"", ""triangleR"", etc., ""coordinates"": object, ""object_id"": string }"
args.name: placed_object

args.info: the duration of the drag in milliseconds
args.name: duration

args.info: "click" or "drag" type of drag used to move the object
args.name: drag_type

args.info: indicates if the round is currently paused after having been started
args.name: round_paused

4022.info: This event occurs when the player clicks the undo button to undo the round playback or last placement. It contains information about the action undone, the current state of the round, and where the click occurred.

args.info:
"the game screen coordinates of the click
dictionary:
{“x”: integer, “y”: integer, “stage_width”: integer, “stage_height”: integer}"
args.name: coordinates

args.info: "placement" or "playback" - the type of action that is being undone
args.name: undo_type

args.info: identifier of the block being removed or none
args.name: block_id

4023.info: This event occurs when the player clicks the undo button to undo the round playback or last placement in create mode. It contains information about the action undone, the current state of the round, and where the click occurred.

args.info: "placement" or "playback" - the type of action that is being undone
args.name: undo_type

args.info: identifier of the object being removed or none
args.name: object_id

4024.info: This event occurs when the player clicks the clear button to clear the scene in create mode.

args.info:
"the game screen coordinates of the click
dictionary:
{“x”: integer, “y”: integer, “stage_width”: integer, “stage_height”: integer}"
args.name: coordinates

args.info:
"layout of the scene that was cleared
{ ""placed_blocks"": [{""block_type"": string, ""block_id"": string, ""coordinates"": object, ""rotation"": float }, ... ], ""hamster_coordinatess"": [ {""hamster_id"": string, ""coordinates"": object}, …], ""carrot_coordinates"": object, ""placed_snacks"": [ { ""snack_id"": string, ""coordinates"": object, ""snack_type"": string }, ... ] }"
args.name: cleared_layout

4025.info: This event occurs when the player removes a block from the scene by dragging it out of play. It contains information about the block removed, the current state of the round, and where the click occurred.

args.info:
"the game screen coordinates of the click
dictionary:
{“x”: integer, “y”: integer, “stage_width”: integer, “stage_height”: integer}"
args.name: coordinates

args.info: identifier of the removed block
args.name: block_id

args.info:
"current layout of the round
{ ""placed_blocks"": [{""block_type"": string, ""block_id"": string, ""coordinates"": object, ""rotation"": float }, ... ], ""hamster_coordinatess"": [ {""hamster_id"": string, ""coordinates"": object}, …] }"
args.name: round_state

args.info: the duration of the drag in milliseconds
args.name: duration

args.info: "click" or "drag" type of drag used to move the object
args.name: drag_type

args.info: indicates if the round is currently paused after having been started
args.name: round_paused

4026.info: This event occurs when the player removes a block from the scene by dragging it out of play during create mode. It contains information about the block removed, the current state of the round, and where the click occurred.

args.info:
"the game screen coordinates of the click
dictionary:
{“x”: integer, “y”: integer, “stage_width”: integer, “stage_height”: integer}"
args.name: coordinates

args.info: identifier of the removed block
args.name: object_id

args.info:
"current layout of the scene
{ ""placed_blocks"": [{""block_type"": string, ""block_id"": string, ""coordinates"": object, ""rotation"": float }, ... ], ""hamster_coordinatess"": [ {""hamster_id"": string, ""coordinates"": object}, …], ""carrot_coordinates"": object, ""placed_snacks"": [ { ""snack_id"": string, ""coordinates"": object, ""snack_type"": string }, ... ] }"
args.name: current_layout

args.info: the duration of the drag in milliseconds
args.name: duration

args.info: "click" or "drag" type of drag used to move the object
args.name: drag_type

args.info: indicates if the scene is currently paused after having been started
args.name: scene_paused

4030.info: This event occurs when the player clicks to pick up or begins dragging the launcher. It contains information about the object being moved, the position of the click, and the state of the game area. This event is used to diagnose player strategies and understanding.

args.info:
"the game screen coordinates of the click
dictionary:
{“x”: integer, “y”: integer, “stage_width”: integer, “stage_height”: integer}"
args.name: coordinates

args.info: “drag” or “click” method of moving object
args.name: drag_type

args.info: identifier of the block being picked up
args.name: block_id

args.info: type of block being picked up
args.name: block_type

args.info:
"""scene"" or ""resources""
location the block is coming from"
args.name: source

4031.info: This event occurs when the player clicks to pick up or begins dragging an object in create mode. It contains information about the object being moved, the position of the click, and the state of the game area. This event is used to diagnose player strategies and understanding.

args.info:
"the game screen coordinates of the click
dictionary:
{“x”: integer, “y”: integer, “stage_width”: integer, “stage_height”: integer}"
args.name: coordinates

args.info: identifier of the removed block
args.name: object_id

args.info: “drag” or “click” method of moving object
args.name: drag_type

args.info:
"""scene"" or ""resources""
location the block is coming from"
args.name: source

args.info: type of object being picked up
args.name: object_type

4035.info: This event occurs when the player drags an object to someplace other than an acceptable destination for the object. It contains information about the object being moved and the destination. The event should occur when the drag is released and the object is placed. These events are used to diagnose player strategies and understanding.

args.info:
"the game screen coordinates of the click
dictionary:
{“x”: integer, “y”: integer, “stage_width”: integer, “stage_height”: integer}"
args.name: coordinates

args.info: identifier of the removed block
args.name: block_id

args.info: “drag” or “click” method of moving object
args.name: drag_type

args.info: the duration of the drag in milliseconds
args.name: duration

args.info: type of block being picked up
args.name: block_type

4036.info: This event occurs when the player drags an object to someplace other than an acceptable destination for the object during create mode. It contains information about the object being moved and the destination. The event should occur when the drag is released and the object is placed. These events are used to diagnose player strategies and understanding.

args.info:
"the game screen coordinates of the click
dictionary:
{“x”: integer, “y”: integer, “stage_width”: integer, “stage_height”: integer}"
args.name: coordinates

args.info: identifier of the removed block
args.name: object_id

args.info: “drag” or “click” method of moving object
args.name: drag_type

args.info: the duration of the drag in milliseconds
args.name: duration

4070.info: This event occurs when the player clicks on something that isn’t covered elsewhere. It can be useful in determining if there are attractive distractions (things the player think should do something, but don’t) in the game, or diagnosing players who are having mechanical difficulties (near misses).

args.info:
"the game screen coordinates of the click
dictionary:
{“x”: integer, “y”: integer, “stage_width”: integer, “stage_height”: integer}"
args.name: coordinates

4080.info: This event occurs when the player hovers the mouse over an interactive object. It contains information about the object under the mouse, and the duration of the hover. This event can be used to diagnose things like planning (are they hovering the mouse over tiles for long periods before they use those tiles), and determine which objects the player thinks are important.

args.info: how long the mouse cursor dwells over the object when the player dwells for longer than 1sec
args.name: dwell_time

args.info: the object the mouse was hovering over
args.name: object

4100.info: Theis event occurs when the player clicks on the Go button to start playback of the round. It contains information about the state of the round when the button is pressed. This event is used to diagnose player strategies and understanding.

args.info:
"the game screen coordinates of the click
dictionary:
{“x”: integer, “y”: integer, “stage_width”: integer, “stage_height”: integer}"
args.name: coordinates

args.info:
"current layout of the round
{ ""placed_blocks"": [{""block_type"": string, ""block_id"": string, ""coordinates"": object, ""rotation"": float }, ... ], ""hamster_coordinatess"": [ {""hamster_id"": string, ""coordinates"": object}, …] }"
args.name: round_state

args.info: indicates if the player is resuming a previously paused playback
args.name: resuming

4101.info: Theis event occurs when the player clicks on the Go button to start playback of the scene during create mode. It contains information about the state of the scene when the button is pressed. This event is used to diagnose player strategies and understanding.

args.info:
"the game screen coordinates of the click
dictionary:
{“x”: integer, “y”: integer, “stage_width”: integer, “stage_height”: integer}"
args.name: coordinates

args.info:
"current layout of the scene
{ ""placed_blocks"": [{""block_type"": string, ""block_id"": string, ""coordinates"": object, ""rotation"": float }, ... ], ""hamster_coordinatess"": [ {""hamster_id"": string, ""coordinates"": object}, …], ""carrot_coordinates"": object, ""placed_snacks"": [ { ""snack_id"": string, ""coordinates"": object, ""snack_type"": string }, ... ] }"
args.name: current_layout

args.info: indicates if the player is resuming a previously paused playback
args.name: resuming

args.name: current_layout

5000.info: This event occurs when the hamster collects one of the target items in the round.

args.info:
"current layout of the round
{ ""placed_blocks"": [{""block_type"": string, ""block_id"": string, ""coordinates"": object, ""rotation"": float }, ... ], ""hamster_coordinatess"": [ {""hamster_id"": string, ""coordinates"": object}, …] }"
